summary: No career growth. Just doing shift work
pros: Good team with great fun. Team outs lunch , games etc
cons: Software company needs hardware development to happen in their own way.

summary: Good place to learn, toxic culture, wlb depends on team
pros: Competition compensation. Stock is good overall. Great place to grind and learn. Good for resume
cons: Toxic culture. Poor leadership. Politics. Less public holidays. 5 days rto is the worst

summary: An intense ride that leads to cynicism
pros: You get to work at a scale and complexity rarely found in other companies
cons: Weaponized leadership principles has led to poor hiring of leadership roles. Zero career growth

summary: Great work life balance if you find a good team
pros: As long as the work is done no one questions you what time you are online/show up to office.
cons: Lot of Bureaucracy and painful promotion process  if the team does not have scope.

summary: Multiple managers, multiple issues come from top-down
pros: Get that bag, get experience, competitive technology with latest and greatest.
cons: Terrible culture, terrible managers, terrible corporate policies, absolutely traumatizing and killed my passion for the craft

summary: Your career growth could be fast in the right environment
pros: As engineer, you have a voice, and have the opportunity to influence a lot of aspect early as long as you argument your case.
cons: it's easy to find toxic management and the good. cjoyour team carefully andd9n't hesitate to jump ship if it's not a good fit.

summary: Okay place
pros:
Can be some cool projects 
Pay isn’t terrible but they screwed everyone this year in comp
cons: Biggest con is that they cut so many positions and keep adding more in everyone else’s plate

summary: Impactful work in selective orgs
pros: Diverse and international environment, strong ownership culture, impactful work, competitive compensation, career growth opportunities, and excellent relocation support.
cons: High work pressure, long hours, limited work-life balance, frequent context switching, intense metrics focus, and occasional communication gaps across teams.

summary: Low pay, poor direction hurt staff, performance, stability
pros: Working alongside smart, capable colleagues fosters a stimulating environment, encourages growth, and enhances collective problem-solving and innovation capabilities significantly. But, this is highly team and org dependent.
cons: Poor pay undervalues staff; unclear management direction causes confusion, lowers morale, hinders performance, and threatens company stability and growth potential.

summary: Great career growth, but worst comp
pros: Good place to learn biggest company working style. AWS access, mature leaders.
cons: Compensation is very bad, worst refresh policy. Too much bureaucracy

summary: Great place to work with a good team
pros:
Great benefits 
Supportive team
Flexible working hours
Great culture, inclusivity
cons: No work life balance as working hours are flexible meaning sometimes will have to work throughout the day

summary: Good
pros:
Good growth opportunities
Meaningful projects to work on
High scope / ownership
cons:
Can be bad wlb sometimes
Oncall can be painful sometimes

summary: Good place to learn a lot of stuff, but not a friendly working environment
pros: You will be able to learn a lot of stuff. Good for career growth (it doesn't mean they will promote you).
cons: The culture is very bad. Managers are slave-driver. They also play nepotism. Only promote people with close and long time relationship with them. No opportunities for you if you don't have this kind of relationship with the managers.

summary: Toxic culture with mediocre pay
pros: My team has decent wlb and good projects to work on
cons: Lots of bias, dominantly Indians, tenure employees are favored, politics everywhere

summary: Great Place to learn and shares but bad managers and Pop
pros: Opportunities work on different projects and learned from people from other teams
cons: Some bad managers, driven by quote and politics, push people onto PIPs or sideline them without understanding their work. After every reorg, some team members end up leaving.

summary: Manager has too much power
pros: Maybe it offers easier opportunity to get hired, especially for international students.
cons:
Observe team culture: Note communication styles, support levels, and collaboration dynamics.

Track manager behavior: If your manager avoids giving support, shifts blame, or isolates you from key projects, that’s a red flag.

Document everything: Keep records of feedback, goals, and deliverables. This protects you and provides clarity in performance reviews.

Network internally: Build relationships across teams. This gives you options and allies if a transfer becomes necessary.

Be proactive: If signs point to being managed out, start looking at internal roles early.

summary: Great opportunity to learn how to deliver globally at scale.
pros: Lots of different divisions to work in with vastly different problem spaces.
cons: Constant grind in an attempt to get promoted with what feels like constantly moving goal posts.

summary: Decent if you are a good engineer
pros: If you are an excellent engineer, you will get promoted fast and get exposure.
cons:
If you are a bad engineer, get PIPed.
No free food. Very frugal.

summary: Good Career Growth - Poor Benefits - Good TC - Poor culture compared to companies of its league
pros: For career growth and experimentation with different kind of work
cons: Your learning will be based on teams you change, as one single team works in very niche tools and problems. The culture is bureaucratic despite being a Day 1 proponent. There is false sense of urgency, and every body is just promotion obsessed and not coustomer obsessed, which leads to fierce internal competition between teams and team members, leading to creation of too much busy work, and short term thinking, and rarely long term thinking, as pressure is to move fast, deliver, not just plan, get promoted or change teams..

summary: Not as bad as people say, better than i expect
pros:
- learn a lot
- good leadership
- high efficiency, zero bullshit
- my team has good oncall shift, only during daytime
- fun coworkers
cons:
- can be stressful at times
- high ops load, not much time to work on features

summary: Low-mid
pros: Competent engineers, growth opportunities are there if you want them
cons: Poor leadership and a work-is-life culture guarantees you'll have an unpleasant at best time here

summary: Managers play elementary school games
pros: None. Managers do nothing to unblock you and play games with your career. Their job is to remove obstacles but instead they create obstacles.
cons: Everything. Too many policies, not enough compute, legal gets in the way, managers have idiot metrics like "docs written" instead of bugs fixed, etc

summary: Toxic culture
pros:
- Relatively stable?
- Pay is not that bad?
- Have some decent people on certain teams?
cons:
- Toxic culture
- Bad career growth
- Not rewarded for hard work

summary: not WLB, smart and capable people
pros: very smart people to work with every day, I enjoy it
cons: tons tons of work, no work life balance, late night meetings

summary: Work life balance depends on the team
pros: Great place to learn and get exposure. Makes you tough on the inside.
cons: Stressful. First line of feedback is often “you will be PIP’d if you don’t deliver”

summary: Good work life harmony bad growth
pros:
Team pretty chill 
Flexible working hours 
Interesting projects to work on
cons: Stagnated career growth due to increased company wide promo difficulty

summary: Cut throat culture
pros: Pay is the only advantage, some people are really smart
cons: Toxic cut throat culture. Terrible managers. No clear vision, priorities change every month. Useless L7 managers.

summary: Grind and Grow
pros: Unless you are coming from a hyper-scaler, Amazon's sheer scale will grow you in one dimension or the other.
cons:
It is easy to burn yourself out just by being part of a competitive grinding culture.

Also, compensation and perks are a testament to Amazon's frugality leadership principle.

summary: Ok for a shorter term
pros: Learned a lot and was on a decent team that helped each other
cons: Culture and decision making that came from very high up that teams had no say in

summary: Disappointing
pros: Brand is able to attract. Global MNC. Salary on time.
cons: Everything else. Politics to grow. Toxic work culture. No plan or vision.
